server/vslabd.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 
00011 #include "includes.h"
00012 
00013 int main(void)
00014 {
00015         int iReturn = 0, iResult = 0;
00016         int iVSLSocket = 0;
00017         int iRcvLen = 0, iSndLen = 0;
00018         unsigned int i;
00019         
00020         struct pl_data vsld_data;
00021         
00022         struct sockaddr_in vsld_remote, vsld_local;
00023         char sndpacket[PL_PACKETSIZE];
00024         char rcvpacket[PL_PACKETSIZE];
00025 
00026         // introducing myself...
00027         printf("VSLab server daemon, version %s, build %s %s\n", VSLD_VERSION, __DATE__, __TIME__);
00028 
00029         // initializing 7seg display driver
00030         sevenseg_open();
00031 
00032         // get a socket descriptor from OS
00033         iVSLSocket = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP);
00034 
00035         if (iVSLSocket < 0)
00036         {
00037                 perror("vslabd: Error creating socket.\n");
00038                 return -ESOCKET;
00039         }
00040 
00041         // initialize server description structure - that's me
00042         vsld_local.sin_family = AF_INET;                        // Ethernet
00043         vsld_local.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY);         // automatically insert own address
00044         vsld_local.sin_port = htons(VSLD_PORT);                 // set vslab server port
00045         memset(&(vsld_local.sin_zero), 0x00, 8);                // set remaining bytes to 0x0
00046 
00047         // initialize client description structure - in fact we don't need to do this as this struct
00048         // will be populated by recvfrom() calls.
00049         vsld_remote.sin_family = AF_INET;                       // Ethernet
00050         vsld_remote.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY);
00051         vsld_remote.sin_port = htons(VSLD_PORT);
00052         memset(&(vsld_remote.sin_zero), 0x00, 8);
00053 
00054         // bind socket
00055         iReturn = bind(iVSLSocket, (struct sockaddr *)&vsld_local, sizeof(struct sockaddr));
00056         if (iReturn < 0)
00057         {
00058                 perror("vslabd: Error binding to socket.\n");
00059                 close(iVSLSocket);
00060                 return -EBIND;
00061         }
00062 
00063         // report status to 7seg display        
00064         sevenseg_setch('0');
00065 
00066         // main loop
00067         for (;;) {
00068                 // wait for incoming requests
00069                 i = sizeof(struct sockaddr);
00070                 tol_start_timeout(VSLD_TIMEOUT_SECS);
00071                 iRcvLen = recvfrom(iVSLSocket, &rcvpacket, PL_PACKETSIZE, 0, (struct sockaddr*)&vsld_remote, &i);
00072                 tol_stop_timeout();
00073                 if (tol_is_timed_out()) {
00074                         tol_reset_timeout();
00075                         printf("vslabd: Got a timeout. Restarting.\n");
00076                         continue;
00077                 }
00078 
00079                 // extract incoming packet              
00080                 iReturn = pl_extr_packet(rcvpacket, &vsld_data, iRcvLen);
00081 
00082                 // check for error during packet extraction
00083                 if(iReturn < 0) {
00084                         pl_create_error(&vsld_data, PL_ERR_GENERALERROR);
00085                 }
00086                 // check packet type
00087                 else if (PLM_PACKET_TYPE(vsld_data) != PL_PTYPE_REQ) {
00088                         pl_create_error(&vsld_data, PL_ERR_INVALIDTYPE);
00089                 }
00090                 // check packet mode. We're a server, so we won't accept server packets!
00091                 else if (PLM_PACKET_MODE(vsld_data) != PL_MODE_CLN) {
00092                         pl_create_error(&vsld_data, PL_ERR_INVALIDMODE);
00093                 }
00094                 // this is our core job - switch to the requested function id...
00095                 else switch(PLM_FUNCTION_ID(vsld_data)) {
00096                         case PL_FID_MUL:
00097                                 // multiply operands 0 and 1 of the received packet
00098                                 printf("vslabd: Calculating %d * %d...\n", PLM_OPERAND(vsld_data,0), PLM_OPERAND(vsld_data,1));
00099                                 iResult = PLM_OPERAND(vsld_data,0) * PLM_OPERAND(vsld_data,1);
00100                                 pl_create_response(&vsld_data);
00101                                 PLM_OPERAND(vsld_data, 0) = iResult;
00102                                 // Report status to 7seg display        
00103                                 sevenseg_setch('1');
00104                                 break;
00105                         case PL_FID_DIV:
00106                                 // divide operand 0 by operand 1 of the received packet
00107                                 printf("vslabd: Calculating %d / %d...\n", PLM_OPERAND(vsld_data,0), PLM_OPERAND(vsld_data,1));
00108                                 // check if divisor is 0
00109                                 if (PLM_OPERAND(vsld_data,1) == 0) {
00110                                         pl_create_error(&vsld_data, PL_ERR_FUNCEXECERROR);
00111                                         // report status to 7seg display        
00112                                         sevenseg_setch('E');
00113                                 }
00114                                 else {
00115                                         iResult = PLM_OPERAND(vsld_data,0) / PLM_OPERAND(vsld_data,1);
00116                                         pl_create_response(&vsld_data);
00117                                         PLM_OPERAND(vsld_data, 0) = iResult;
00118                                         // report status to 7seg display        
00119                                         sevenseg_setch('2');
00120                                 }
00121                                 break;
00122                         default:
00123                                 // function is not implemented - create an error packet
00124                                 pl_create_error(&vsld_data, PL_ERR_NOSUCHFUNCTION);
00125                                 // report status to 7seg display        
00126                                 sevenseg_setch('F');
00127                                 break;
00128                 }
00129 
00130                 // convert and send packet
00131                 pl_make_packet(&vsld_data, sndpacket, PL_PACKETSIZE);
00132                 iSndLen = sendto(iVSLSocket, &sndpacket, PL_PACKETSIZE, 0, (struct sockaddr*)&vsld_remote, sizeof(struct sockaddr));
00133         }
00134         sevenseg_close();
00135         return 0;
00136 }
